thread.title: Industrialism and Strikes.

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Industrialism and Strikes.
text: PEOPLE interested in the development of industries will do well to note an important fact mentioned in the last factory report of Bombay. Referring to the few strikes that occurred during the year the report says that they were due to a demand for increased wages or as a protest against any attempt at reduction due to a fail in the prices of manufactured articles. What is noteworthy is that "in almost every case the demand of the worker had to be conceded." If such is the case when labour is not ogranised on any trade Union basis, what will be condition in future? It is singular how industrial development introduce certain economic conditions among the workers who feel bound to adopt "strikes" when their working conditions or wages are interfered with. The "dearth of labour" is either a demand for efficiency which is not met or a protest against conditions of wages and work.
